summary: Albert Maxwell was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He is listed in payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. The documents list his name, salary, and pay during those periods, indicating he was a staff member during that time frame.
significance: Albert Maxwell's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, though the specific nature and extent of his role are not detailed in these documents.
